bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, January 8, 1952

div1.p: Hench hopes he will be able to see Rojas and Cabrera when he is in Havana. He sends her a copy of his letter to Nogueira, and hopes she might help Nogueira arrange appointments for Hench related to the Camp Lazear preservation.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, January 8, 1952
div1.opener:
January 8, 1952
Senorita Maria Teresa Rojas
Quinta San Jose
Calle Real
Quemados de Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senorita Rojas:
div1.p:
Some months ago Mary and I had a very nice
note from you. You were about to go to Europe
again I believe, or was it New York.

I do hope that we will have a chance to see
you and Senorita Cabrera while we are in Havana,
from January 21 to 26. I had hoped to have some-
thing of a rest but already I have been notified
of various official functions, luncheons, etc.,

Please note the enclosed letter which I have
sent to Doctor Nogueira. I don't know whether
you could help him arrange the appropriate
appointments for me, but if so, I would be very
grateful. I do want to tell you of some new prospective
help from this country, providing your countrymen
start the ball rolling.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
